intro: Spilanthes guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan toothache plant, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the genus Spilanthes within the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and pungent, peppery scent. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in open, sunny habitats. Its unique botanical features make it a subject of interest in both traditional medicine and botanical research.
